member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDisplayMode.UseThumbs
member.summary: Thumbnail images visible.

member.summary: Full screen mode, with no menu bar, window controls, or any other window visible.

member.summary: Optional content panel visible.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDisplayMode.UseAttachments

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocumentSaveFormat
member.summary: Specifies the available save formats for a PDF document.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocumentSaveFormat.Regular
member.summary: Regular PDF file, no format restrictions apply.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocumentSaveFormat.PDFA1b
member.summary: File is saved in PDF/A-1b format, format restrictions apply according to standard.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMagnificationMode
member.summary: Specifies the available zoom modes that can be applied when the PDF page specified in the destination is displayed.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMagnificationMode.XYZ
member.summary: Display the destination page at the specified position and zoom.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMagnificationMode.Fit
member.summary: Display the destination page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the entire page within the window both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMagnificationMode.FitH
member.summary: Display the destination page at the specified top position and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of the page within the window.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMagnificationMode.FitV
member.summary: Display the destination page at the specified left position and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of the page within the window.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMagnificationMode.FitR
member.summary: Display the destination page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit the rectangle specified by the coordinates left, bottom, right, and top entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMagnificationMode.FitB
member.summary: Display the destination page, with its contents magnified just enough to fit its bounding box entirely within the window both horizontally and vertically.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMagnificationMode.FitBH
member.summary: Display the destination page at the specified top position and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire width of its bounding box within the window.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMagnificationMode.FitBV
member.summary: Display the destination page at the specified left position and the contents of the page magnified just enough to fit the entire height of its bounding box within the window.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBookmark
member.summary: Defines a bookmark in a PDF file.
member.remarks: The bookmarks have a tree structure that allows an easier navigation into the document. The bookmarks tree serves as a table of contents for the document.

member.summary: Gets the collection of child bookmarks.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBookmark.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the bookmark color.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBookmark.Dictionary
member.summary: Gets the bookmark dictionary.
member.remarks: This property gives you direct access to bookmark dictionary and its associated resources. Note: Modifying directly the bookmark dictionary without good knowledge of the PDF specification can lead to unexpected results, such as invalid PDF files.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBookmark.DisplayStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the display style of this bookmark.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBookmark.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the bookmark should be displayed in collapsed or expanded state.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBookmark.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent of this PDFBookmark object.
member.remarks: If the parent bookmark is null, the bookmark is a top level bookmark.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBookmark.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of this bookmark.
member.remarks: The title is displayed by the viewer application in the bookmarks tree.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDestination
member.summary: Defines the base class for PDF destinations.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDestination.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFDestination object.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDirectDestination
member.summary: Defines the base class direct PDF destinations.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDirectDestination.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFDirectDestination object.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDirectDestination.Bottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the bottom coordinate in the page where the viewer should display the page.
member.remarks: When the destination page of this action is displayed, the viewer will try to display the page at the given coordinate. It is relative to the top of the page. This value is used by the following magnification modes: MagnificationMode.FitR

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDirectDestination.Left
member.summary: Gets or sets the left coordinate in the page where the viewer should display the page.
member.remarks: When the destination page is displayed, the viewer will try to display the page at the given coordinate. This value is relative to the left margin of the page, 0 value meaning that the page will be displayed starting from its left margin. A -1 value for this property means that the current left coordinate used by the viewer will not be changed when dispaying the page. This value is used by the following magnification modes: O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.MagnificationMode.XYZ, O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.MagnificationMode.FitV, O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.MagnificationMode.FitR, O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.MagnificationMode.FitBV

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDirectDestination.MagnificationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the magnification mode.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDirectDestination.Right
member.summary: Gets or sets the right coordinate in the page where the viewer should display the page.
member.remarks: When the destination page of this action is displayed, the viewer will try to display the page at the given coordinate. This value is used by the following magnification modes: MagnificationMode.FitR

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDirectDestination.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the top coordinate in the page where the viewer should display the page.
member.remarks: When the destination page is displayed, the viewer will try to display the page at the given coordinate. This value is relative to the top of the page, 0 value meaning that the top of the page will be displayed. A -1 value for this property means that the current top coordinate used by the viewer will not be changed when dispaying the page. This value is used by the following magnification modes: O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFMagnificationMode.XYZ, O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFMagnificationMode.FitH, O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFMagnificationMode.FitR, O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFMagnificationMode.FitBH

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDirectDestination.Zoom
member.summary: Gets or sets the zoom factor to be used when the page is displayed.
member.remarks: When the destination page is displayed, it will be magnified using the zoom factor specified by this property. This value is used only in conjunction with XYZ magnification mode ( see PDFMagnificationMode enumeration) and it is given as percents (100 means 100 zoom). A 0 value for this property means that the current zoom factor used by the viewer will not be changed when displaying the page.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocument
member.summary: Represents a PDF document.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocument.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFDocument object.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocument.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFDocument object.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocument.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFDocument object based on an existing pdf document.
member.remarks: This constructor imports an existing pdf file into the document object. It automatically populates the Pages collection with the pages of the given document. After the document object has been created, it can be used as any regular document object. New content can be added to imported pages (the new content is drawn on top of existing content) or to new pages.
member.param: a Stream descendant storing the pdf file used as source for creating this PDFDocument object.

New content can be added to imported pages (the new content is drawn on top of existing content) or to new pages.
member.param: a Stream descendant storing the pdf file used as source for creating this PDFDocument object.
the user or owner password used to decrypt the PDF file.

member.summary: Begins to save the document.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocument.BeginSave(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Begins to save the document.
member.remarks: This method, together with Int32) and EndSave, allows to save a PDF document page by page thus reducing the memory consumption. Once a page has been saved, it can no longer be used, its properties and invalid.

True if the file should be saved in fast web view format (linearized).

member.summary: Saves the PDF document to a stream.
member.remarks: The stream needs to be created prior saving the PDF file.
member.param: The stream object where PDF document will be saved.
Options for saving the PDF file.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocument.SavePage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves the specified page.
member.remarks: This method, together with Stream) and EndSave, allows to save a PDF document page by page thus reducing the memory consumption. Once a page has been saved, it can no longer be used, its properties and invalid.
member.param: The number of the page to save.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocument.SavePageContent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Saves the content of the specified page.
member.remarks: This method, together with Stream), Int32) and EndSave, allows to save a PDF document page by page and page content by page content thus reducing the memory consumption. This method lets you save pieces of the page content while making possible to add new content to the page after the save. In this way, if the page content is very large, if can be saved piece by piece by calling this method multiple times. After the page is completed a call to Int32) is required.
member.param: The number of the page to save.

member.summary: Gets the document catalog dictionary.
member.remarks: This property gives you direct access to document catalog dictionary and the entire PDF tree. Starting with the document catalog dictionary every bit of information stored in the PDF file can be accessed using the low level COS objects even if it is not avialable through PDF4NET public API. Note: Modifying directly the document catalog dictionary without good knowledge of the PDF specification can lead to unexpected results, such as invalid PDF files.

member.summary: Initializes a new PDFDocumentSaveOptions

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the document should be saved in fast web view mode or not.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocumentSaveOptions.IncrementalUpdate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether incremental update should be used of document save or not.
member.remarks: Incremental update should be used when the document has been partially loaded (any of the properties of the PDFDocumentLoadOptions object have been set to false). Incremental updates allow faster saves of the PDF document because only the modified objects are appended at the end of the source file. Incremental updates work only when the source document is loaded from disk and not from a stream. If the document has been partially loaded but this property is false, the remaining parts of the document will be loaded in memory before saving the file.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage
member.summary: Defines a page within the pdf document.
member.remarks: This class is used to create new pages in a pdf document. The pages can be created in any order. The position of the page in the Pages collection gives the position of the page within the final pdf file. The content of the page is mainly created using the Canvas property of the page.

member.summary: Initializes a new PDFPage object.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageDestination.Page
member.summary: Gets or sets the destination page.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumber
member.summary: Defines the visual aspect of the page number when it is drawn on the page
member.remarks: This class works in conjunction with PDFPageNumberingRange class. In order to have the page number automatically drawn on the page, at least one numberig range must be defined for the document and the page must be included in the interval defined by the numbering range.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumber.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PageNumber object. Supported by Compact .NET Edition.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumber.Align
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of text used to draw the page number.
member.remarks: This property is used to position the page number within the page. Top and bottom alignments use VerticalOffset property to position the page number. Left and right alignments use HorizontalOffset property to position the page number. Middle and center alignments center the page number on vertical, respectivelly on horizontal.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumber.Brush
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush used to draw the page number.
member.remarks: This PDFBrush object is used to fill the interior of the text representing the page number. If this is null, then the text will be drawn unfilled. The default value of this property is a brush of black color.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumber.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the font used to draw the page number.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumber.HorizontalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal offset used to position the page number.
member.remarks: The horizontal offset is used when the page number is left or right aligned. When the page number is left aligned, the horizontal offset represents the distance between the left margin of the page and the left corner of the rectangle bounding the page number. When the page number is right aligned, the horizontal offset represents the distance between the right margin of the page and the right corner of the rectangle bounding the page number. When the page number is center aligned on the horizontal, the horizontal offset is not used. The horizontal center of the bounding rectangle is positioned at half of page width.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumber.Pen
member.summary: Gets or sets the pen used to draw the page number.
member.remarks: This PDFPen object is used to draw the border of the text representing the page number. If this is null, then the text will be drawn without border. The default value of this property is null.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumber.VerticalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical offset used to position the page number.
member.remarks: The vertical offset is used when the page number is top or bottom aligned. When the page number is top aligned, the vertical offset represents the distance between the top margin of the page and the top corner of the rectangle bounding the page number. When the page number is bottom aligned, the vertical offset represents the distance between the bottom margin of the page and the bottom corner of the rectangle bounding the page number. When the page number is middle aligned on the vertical, the vertical offset is not used. The vertical middle of the bounding rectangle is positioned at half of page height.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumberingRange
member.summary: Defines a series of consecutive pages within the PDF document using the same numbering system
member.remarks: A numbering range defines a set of consecutive pages that use the same numbering system. The range is considered to start from the page specified by StartPageIndex property and ends at the last page of the document. If multiple numbering ranges are defined, then a numbering range ends where the next numbering range starts. The numbering ranges of a document are ordered ascending by StartPageIndex property. For example, a document has an introduction on first 3 pages, then it starts first chapter from the 4th page. A numbering range starting at index zero can be defined for the introduction using roman numerals, then a new numbering range can be defined starting at index 3 using arabic numerals. For this new range, the start page number can be set to 1, this being the first logical page, although it is the 4th physical page in the document.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumberingRange.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFPageNumberingRange object.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumberingRange.NumberingStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual style of the page numbers for this PageNumberingRange object.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumberingRange.PageNumberPrefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the prefix that will be appended in front of the page number.
member.remarks: This prefix is printed on the pages in the range before the page number. All pages in a range share the same prefix. This prefix is also visible in the Print dialog box of the PDF viewer, when specifing a range of pages to print.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumberingRange.PageNumberSuffix
member.summary: Gets or sets the suffix that will be appended at the end of the page number.
member.remarks: This prefix is printed on the pages in the range after the page number. All pages in a range share the same suffix.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumberingRange.StartPageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the start page where the numbering range starts.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageNumberingRange.StartPageNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the page number the numbering of the pages starts for this range.
member.remarks: This property specifies the page number that will be printed on the first page in this range. The other pages will be numbered consecutively, starting from this value. It represents a logical page number and it is related to the specific content of the document.

member.summary: Defines a collection of bookmarks.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFResetFormAction
member.summary: Defines a SubmitForm action.
member.remarks: This action allows a user to reset the form fields to their default values.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFResetFormAction.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFResetFormAction object.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFResetFormAction.Fields
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of fields affected by this action.
member.remarks: The ResetFields property controls how the fields in this collection are reset. If ResetFields property is true, only the fields in this collection will be reset. If ResetFields property is false, the fields in this collection are not reset and only the remaining form fields are reset. If the collection is null or empty, then all the form fields are reset and the ResetFields property is ignored.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFResetFormAction.ResetFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the fields in Fields collection should be reset or not.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFSubmitFormAction
member.summary: Defines a SubmitForm action.
member.remarks: This action allows a user to submit the form data to a specified URL.

member.summary: Initializes a new PDFSubmitFormAction object.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFSubmitFormAction.DataFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of the data being submitted.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFSubmitFormAction.EmbedForm
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the PDF document is embedded in the submitted FDF file.
member.remarks: This property has meaning only if DataFormat property is DataFormat.FDF.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFSubmitFormAction.ExcludeNonUserAnnotations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether only the annotations whose author is the current user should be submitted.
member.remarks: This property has meaning only if DataFormat property is DataFormat.FDF and IncludeAnnotations property is true.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFSubmitFormAction.Fields
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of fields affected by this action.
member.remarks: The SubmitFields property controls how the fields in this collection are submitted to the specified URL. If SubmitFields property is true, only the fields in this collection will be submitted. If SubmitFields property is false, the fields in this collection will not be submitted and only the remaining form fields will be submitted. If the collection is null or empty, then all the form fields are submitted and the SubmitFields property is ignored. In any of the situations above, the fields with PDFField.NoExport property set to true will not be submitted.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFSubmitFormAction.IncludeAnnotations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the markup annotations in the underlying PDF document are included in the submitted FDF file.
member.remarks: This property has meaning only if DataFormat property is DataFormat.FDF.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFSubmitFormAction.IncludeAppendSaves
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the incremental updates to the underlying PDF document are included in the submitted FDF file.
member.remarks: This property has meaning only if DataFormat property is DataFormat.FDF.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFSubmitFormAction.IncludeNoValueFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the fields with no value should be submitted.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the coordinates of the mouse click that caused the submit form action are transmitted as part of form data.
member.remarks: This property has meaning only if DataFormat property is DataFormat.HTML.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFSubmitFormAction.SubmitFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the fields in Fields collection should be submitted or not.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFSubmitFormAction.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL for submitting the form data.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Actions.PDFSubmitFormAction.UseCanonicalDateTimeFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the field values representing dates should be submitted using PDF date/time format.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the field names and values should be submitted using HTTP GET method.
member.remarks: This property has meaning only if DataFormat property is DataFormat.HTML or DataFormat.PDF.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DActivationMode
member.summary: Specifies the available modes for activating a 3D annotation.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DActivationMode.PageOpen
member.summary: The annotation should be activated as soon as the page containing the annotation is opened.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DActivationMode.PageVisible
member.summary: The annotation should be activated as soon as any part of the page containing the annotation becomes visible.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DActivationMode.ExplicitActivation
member.summary: The annotation should remain inactive until explicitly activated by a script or user action.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DActivationState
member.summary: Specifies the available states upon activation of the 3D annotation.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DActivationState.Instantiated
member.summary: The artwork is instantiated, but real-time script-driven animations are disabled.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DActivationState.Live
member.summary: Real-time script-driven animations are enabled if present; if not, the artwork is instantiated.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DAnimationType
member.summary: Specifies the available styles for applying light to 3D artwork.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DAnimationType.None
member.summary: Animations are driven through alternate means, such as JavaScript.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DAnimationType.Linear
member.summary: Keyframe animations are driven linearly from beginning to end.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DAnimationType.Oscillating
member.summary: Keyframe animations should oscillate along their time range.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DDeactivationMode
member.summary: Specifies the available modes for activating a 3D annotation.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DDeactivationMode.PageClose
member.summary: The annotation should be deactivated as soon as the page is closed.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DDeactivationMode.PageInvisible
member.summary: The annotation should be deactivated as soon as the page containing the annotation becomes invisible.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DDeactivationMode.ExplicitDeactivation
member.summary: The annotation should remain active until explicitly deactivated by a script or user action.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DDeactivationState
member.summary: Specifies the available states upon deactivation of the 3D annotation.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DDeactivationState.Uninstantiated
member.summary: The artwork is uninstantiated.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DDeactivationState.Instantiated
member.summary: The artwork remains instantiated.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DDeactivationState.Live
member.summary: The artwork remains live.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle
member.summary: Specifies the available styles for applying light to 3D artwork.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle.Artwork
member.summary: Lights as specified in the 3D artwork.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle.None
member.summary: No lights are used.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle.White
member.summary: Three blue-grey infinite lights, no ambient term.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle.Day
member.summary: Three light-grey infinite lights, no ambient term.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle.Night
member.summary: One yellow, one aqua, and one blue infinite light, no ambient term.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle.Hard
member.summary: Three grey infinite lights, moderate ambient term.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle.Primary
member.summary: One red, one green, and one blue infinite light, no ambient term.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle.Blue
member.summary: Three blue infinite lights, no ambient term.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle.Red
member.summary: Three red infinite lights, no ambient term.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle.Cube
member.summary: Six grey infinite lights aligned with the major axes, no ambient term.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle.CAD
member.summary: Three grey infinite lights and one light attached to the camera, no ambient term.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DLightingStyle.Headlamp
member.summary: Single infinite light attached to the camera, low ambient term.

member.summary: Fit max between width and height.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DProjectionType.Orthographic
member.summary: Orthographic projection.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DProjectionType.Perspective
member.summary: Perspective projection.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle
member.summary: Specifies the available styles for rendering the 3D artwork.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.Solid
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes. The auxiliary color is ignored.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.SolidWireframe
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes (triangles) with single color edges on top of them. The color of these edges is determined by the auxiliary color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.Transparent
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes (triangles) with an added level of transparency. The auxiliary color is ignored.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.TransparentWireframe
member.summary: Displays textured and lit geometric shapes (triangles) with an added level of transparency, with single color opaque edges on top of it. The color of these edges is determined by the auxiliary color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.BoundingBox
member.summary: Displays the bounding box edges of each node. The color of the bounding box edges is determined by the auxiliary color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.TransparentBoundingBox
member.summary: Displays bounding boxes faces of each node with an added level of transparency. The color of the bounding box faces is determined by the face color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.TransparentBoundingBoxOutline
member.summary: Displays bounding boxes edges and faces of each node with an added level of transparency. The color of the bounding box edges is determined by the auxiliary color. The color of the bounding boxes faces is determined by the face color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.Wireframe
member.summary: Displays only edges in a single color. The color of these edges is determined by the auxiliary color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.ShadedWireframe
member.summary: Displays only edges and applies lighting. The auxiliary color is ignored.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.HiddenWireframe
member.summary: Displays edges in a single color, though removes back-facing and obscured edges. The color of these edges is determined by the auxiliary color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.Vertices
member.summary: Displays only vertices in a single color. The color of these points is determined by the auxiliary color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.ShadedVertices
member.summary: Displays only vertices, though uses their vertex color and applies lighting. The auxiliary color is ignored.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.Illustration
member.summary: Displays silhouette edges with surfaces, removes obscured lines. The color of these edges is determined by the auxiliary color, and the color of the surfaces is determined by the face color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.SolidOutline
member.summary: Displays silhouette edges with lit and textured surfaces, removes obscured lines. The color of these edges is determined by the auxiliary color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DRenderStyle.ShadedIllustration
member.summary: Displays silhouette edges with lit and textured surfaces and an additional emissive term to remove poorly lit areas of the artwork. The color of these edges is determined by the auxiliary color.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFAnnotationFlags
member.summary: Specifies the available flags for an annotation.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFAnnotationFlags.Invisible
member.summary: If set, do not display the annotation if it does not belong to one of the standard annotation types.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFAnnotationFlags.Hidden
member.summary: If set, do not display or print the annotation or allow it to interact with the user.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFAnnotationFlags.Print
member.summary: If set, print the annotation when the page is printed. If clear, never print the annotation, regardless of whether it is displayed on the screen.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFAnnotationFlags.NoZoom
member.summary: If set, do not scale the annotation's appearance to match the magnification of the page.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFAnnotationFlags.NoRotate
member.summary: If set, do not rotate the annotation's appearance to match the rotation of the page.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFAnnotationFlags.NoView
member.summary: If set, do not display the annotation on the screen or allow it to interact with the user. The annotation may be printed (depending on the Print flag), but should be considered hidden for the purposes of onscreen display and user interaction.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFAnnotationFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: If set, do not allow the annotation to interact with the user.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFAnnotationFlags.Locked
member.summary: If set, do not allow the annotation to be deleted or its properties (including position and size) to be modified by the user. However, this flag does not restrict changes to the annotation’s contents, such as the value of a form field.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFAnnotationFlags.ToggleNoView
member.summary: If set, invert the interpretation of the NoView flag for certain events.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFAnnotationFlags.LockedContents
member.summary: If set, do not allow the contents of the annotation to be modified by the user. This flag does not restrict deletion of the annotation or changes to other annotation properties, such as position and size.

member.summary: Initializes a new PDF3DCrossSection object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the center of the cutting plane.
member.remarks: If the array has more than 3 elements, only the first 3 will be considered.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DCrossSection.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the cutting plane color.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DCrossSection.IntersectionColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the intersection color.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DCrossSection.IntersectionIsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the intersection of cutting plane with 3D artwork is visible.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DCrossSection.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the cutting plane opacity.
member.remarks: The opacity is given in percents, 100 is full opacity, 0 is no opacity.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDF3DCrossSection.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the cutting plane.
member.remarks: If the array has more than 3 elements, only the first 3 will be considered. Exactly one of the values must be null, indicating an initial state of the cutting plane that is perpendicular to the corresponding axis and clipping all geometry on the positive side of that axis. The other two values must be numbers indicating the rotation of the plane, in degrees, around their corresponding axes. The order in which these rotations are applied should match the order in which the values appear in the array.

member.summary: Gets or sets the near clipping distance.
member.remarks: This property has meaning only if ClipStyle property is ExplicitNearFar or if Type is Perspective. This property must be non-negative for orthographic projections and greater than 0 for perspective projections.

member.summary: Flattens the annotation.
member.remarks: This operation writes the annotation appearance to the content and destroys the annotation. Its effects are irreversible. After calling this method the PDFAnnotation object is invalid and should no longer be used.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFMovieAnnotation.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of the movie clip.
member.remarks: If this property is -1, the actual movie duration is used for playing the movie. If this property is 0, the duration is infinity. If the duration is greater than actual movie duration, when the movie ends, the player displays the last frame till the specified duration elapses. If the duration is lower than actual movie duration, the movie ends when the duration elapses.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFRubberStampAnnotation.Appearance
member.summary: Gets or sets the annotation appearance.
member.remarks: When this property is set to a valid appearance, the Icon is set to Custom and the IconName is set to "Custom". If you want to use your custom icon name, make sure you set the IconName property after this property is set.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Annotations.PDFRubberStampAnnotation.IconName
member.summary: Gets or sets the icon name.
member.remarks: This property lets you set a custom name for your user defined stamp appearances. If the Icon property to any of the PDFStampAnnotationIcon enum values, the IconName property will be set automatically to the corresponding string value. If the IconName property to a predefined icon name (names available in PDFRubberStampAnnotationIcon enumeration), the Icon property will be set accordingly, otherwise the Icon property will be set to Custom

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField
member.summary: Defines the base class for form fields in a PDF form.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the internal resources.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.CalculateAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the JavaScript action to be executed for calculating the field value.
member.remarks: This property specifies a JavaScript action to be performed to recalculate the value of this field when that of another field changes. This action has no meaning for PDFPushButtonField, PDFCheckBoxField, PDFRadioButtonListField and PDFListBoxField fields.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.Dictionary
member.summary: Gets the field dictionary.
member.remarks: This property gives you direct access to field dictionary and its associated resources. Note: Modifying directly the field dictionary without good knowledge of the PDF specification can lead to unexpected results, such as invalid PDF files.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.Form
member.summary: Gets the form that contains this field.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.FormatAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the JavaScript action to be executed for formating the field value.
member.remarks: This property specifies a JavaScript action to be performed before the field is formatted to display its current value. This action can modify the field’s value before formatting. This action has no meaning for PDFPushButtonField, PDFCheckBoxField, PDFRadioButtonListField and PDFListBoxField fields.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.KeyPressAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the JavaScript action to be executed when the user types a keystroke.
member.remarks: This property specifies a JavaScript action to be performed when the user types a keystroke into a text field or combo box or modifies the selection in a scrollable list box. This action can check the keystroke for validity and reject or modify it. This action has no meaning for PDFPushButtonField, PDFCheckBoxField and PDFRadioButtonListField fields.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.MappingName
member.summary: Gets or sets the mapping name of the field.
member.remarks: The field's mapping name is used when exporting interactive form field data from the document.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the field name.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.NoExport
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the field can be exported or not.
member.remarks: If true, the field must not be exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.ReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the field is read-only.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.Required
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the field is required.
member.remarks: If true, the field must have a value when it is exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.Tooltip
member.summary: Gets or sets the field tooltip.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.Type
member.summary: Gets the field type.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.ValidateAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the JavaScript action to be executed for validating the field value.
member.remarks: This property specifies a JavaScript action to be performed when the field’s value is changed. This action can check the new value for validity. This action has no meaning for PDFPushButtonField, PDFCheckBoxField, PDFRadioButtonListField and PDFListBoxField fields.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the field value.
member.remarks: The value type depends on the actual field. Check box fields accept string and boolean values while other fields work only with strings. If other type is provided, it will be converted to string.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFFieldWidget.Flatten
member.summary: Flattens the field widget.
member.remarks: This operation writes the field appearance to the page content and destroys the widget. Its effects are irreversible. After calling this method the PDFFieldWidget object is invalid and should no longer be used. If this is the only widget of the field, the field object will also be removed from the document and destroyed.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFForm.ExportData
member.summary: Exports the form data to a file.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFForm.ExportData(System.String,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFFormDataFormat,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFExportDataOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Exports the form data to a file.
member.remarks: The name of the source PDF file is required because the data files (both FDF and XFDF) need a reference to the PDF file from which they were exported. This file name does not need to match the actual file name used for saving the PDF document.
member.param: The full path to the file where form data will be exported.
The format of exported data.
Options for specifying the type of data to be exported.
The name of the PDF file the data is exported from.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFForm.ExportData(System.IO.Stream,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFFormDataFormat,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFExportDataOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Exports the form data to a stream.
member.remarks: The name of the source PDF file is required because the data files (both FDF and XFDF) need a reference to the PDF file from which they were exported. This file name does not need to match the actual file name used for saving the PDF document.
member.param: The stream where form data will be exported.
The format of exported data.
Options for specifying the type of data to be exported.
The name of the PDF file the data is exported from.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFForm.FlattenFormField(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFField)
member.summary: Flattens the specified form field, making the field uneditable.
member.remarks: This action is ireversible. Once the form field has been flattened, it can no longer be edited.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFForm.FlattenFormFields
member.summary: Flattens all the fields in the PDF form, making the PDF file uneditable.
member.remarks: This action is ireversible. Once the form fields have been flattened, they can no longer be edited.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFForm.ImportData(System.String,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFFormDataFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Imports form data from an external file.
member.returns: An array with the errors occured during the import.
member.remarks: If no errors occured during the import, the returned array is null (Nothing in VB.NET).
member.param: The file from which to import form data.
The format of input file.
False if the import should stop on the first field that generates an error, or true if the import should ignore the error and continue with the next field.

member.summary: Imports form data from a XFDF file.
member.returns: An array with the errors occured during the import.
member.remarks: If no errors occured during the import, the returned array is null (Nothing in VB.NET).
member.param: A XFDFFile object that stores the form data.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFListField.CommitOnSelChange
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the selected item is commited as soon as the selection is made.
member.remarks: If set, the new value is committed as soon as a selection is made with the pointing device. This option enables applications to perform an action once a selection is made, without requiring the user to exit the field. If clear, the new value is not committed until the user exits the field.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFListField.Items
member.summary: Gets the collection of items in the list.
member.remarks: Use this property to get the properties of items in the list.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFListField.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the lowest ordinal index of the selected items in the list.
member.remarks: Use this property to determine the index of the currently selected item in the list if the list control allows only one selection.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFListField.SelectedItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the first selected item in the list.
member.remarks: null (Nothing in VB.NET) means that no item is selected. If the item does not exist in the list, an exception is thrown.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.PDFListField.SelectedValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the first selected item in the list.
member.remarks: When setting the selected value, if the value does not exist in the list, an exception is thrown.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the field acts like a comb or not.
member.remarks: If this property is true, the field is automatically divided into as many equally spaced positions, or combs, as the value of MaxLen property and the text is laid out into those combs. When this property is set to true, the Multiline and Password properties are automatically set to false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the max length of the text that can be inserted in the field.
member.remarks: If this property is 0, then the text length is unlimited.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAChoiceListDisplayMode.UserControl
member.summary: The drop down list is displayed when the user clicks on the field or on the arrow button.

member.summary: The drop down list is displayed when the field gets the focus.

member.summary: The drop down list is always displayed (the field is a list box).

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAChoiceListDisplayMode.Multiselect
member.summary: The drop down list is always displayed and allows selection of multiple items (the field is a list box).

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAContentAccess
member.summary: Specifies the access modes to the content of a container.
member.remarks: Fields with Protected or ReadOnly access can not be updated from code.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAContentAccess.NonInteractive
member.summary: Allows the content to be loaded from the data document, but not updated interactively.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAContentAccess.Open
member.summary: Allow update without restriction.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAContentAccess.Protected
member.summary: The processing application must prevent the user from making any direct changes to the container's content. Indirect changes (e.g., via calculations) may occur. A protected container will not generate any events.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAContentAccess.ReadOnly
member.summary: The processing application must not allow the user to make direct changes to the container's content. Indirect changes (e.g., via calculations) may occur. A protected container will not generate a subset of regular events (those that are not related to direct modification of the content).

member.summary: The image is scaled to maximum possible size while keeping the original aspect ratio.

member.summary: The image is scaled to occupy the entire field area.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAImageAspect.Height

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the check button allows neutral state.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAChoiceListField
member.summary: Defines a XFA choice list field.
member.remarks: The field can be either a drop down list or a list box, depending on the DisplayMode property.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAChoiceListField.DisplayMode
member.summary: Gets the display mode of the drop down choice list.
member.remarks: If the value of this property is Always or Multiselect, then the choice list is presented as a list box in user interactive applications, otherwise it is presented as a drop down list.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAChoiceListField.Items
member.summary: Gets the collection of items in the choice list.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAChoiceListField.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the lowest ordinal index of the selected items in the list.
member.remarks: Use this property to determine the index of the currently selected item in the list if the list control allows only one selection.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAChoiceListField.SelectedItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the first selected item in the list.
member.remarks: If the item to select does not exist in the list, current selection is not changed. If the item to select is null, then the selection is reset and SelectedIndex property becomes -1.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFAChoiceListField.SelectedValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the first selected item in the list.
member.remarks: When setting the selected value, if the value does not exist in the list, an exception is thrown. If the value to select is null (Nothing in VB.NET), then the selection is reset and SelectedIndex property becomes -1.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFADateTimeEditField
member.summary: Defines a XFA date/time edit field.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Forms.XFA.XFADateTimeEditField.DateTimeValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time.
member.remarks: The value of this property is controlled by ValueType property. When ValueType property is Date, only the date part of the DateTime value is stored and the time part is set to 12:00:00 AM. When ValueType property is DateTime, the complete DateTime value is stored. When ValueType property is Time, only the time part of the DateTime value is stored and the date part is set to 01 January 0001. This property returns 01 January 0001 even if the field does not contain any value. In order to find out if the field is empty compare the Value property to null (Nothing in VB.NET). Set the Value property to null (Nothing in VB.NET) in order to clear the field value.

member.remarks: The values accepted by this property depend on the actual field type. If the actual field does not support the provided value, an exception is raised. If the field Access is Protected or ReadOnly, the Value can not be changed. Fields with a fixed range of values (checkboxes, radiobutton lists and choice fields) will throw an exception if the value does not exist in their set of values.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType0Function
member.summary: Defines a type 0 function.
member.remarks: Type 0 functions use a sequence of sample values (contained in a stream) to provide an approximation for functions whose domains and ranges are bounded. The samples are organized as an m-dimensional table in which each entry has n components.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType0Function.#ctor
member.summary: Initilizes a new PDFType0Function object.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType0Function.#ctor
member.summary: Initilizes a new PDFType0Function object.

member.summary: Initializes new PdfType0Function object.
member.param: An array of m positive integers specifying the number of samples in each input dimension of the sample table.
The number of bits used to represent each sample.
The interpolation mode between samples.
An array of 2*m numbers specifying the linear mapping of input values into the domain of the function's sample table.
An array of 2*n numbers specifying the linear mapping of sample values into the range appropriate for the function's output values.
Sample function data.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType0Function.BitsPerSample
member.summary: Gets or sets the function's bits per sample.
member.remarks: This property is the number of bits used to represent each sample. (If the function has multiple output values, each one occupies BitsPerSample bits.) Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 16, 24, and 32.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType0Function.Decode
member.summary: Gets or sets the function's decoding array.
member.remarks: The decode is an array of 2*n numbers specifying the linear mapping of sample values into the range appropriate for the function's output values.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType0Function.Encode
member.summary: Gets or sets the function's encoding array.
member.remarks: The encode is an array of 2*m numbers specifying the linear mapping of input values into the domain of the function’s sample table.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType0Function.InterpolationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the function's interpolation mode.
member.remarks: This property specifies how the sample values are interpolated.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType0Function.Samples
member.summary: Get or sets the stream that stores the sample values.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType0Function.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of samples.
member.remarks: An array of m positive integers specifying the number of samples in each input dimension of the sample table.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType3Function
member.summary: Defines a type 3 function.
member.remarks: Type 3 functions define a stitching of the subdomains of several 1-input functions to produce a single new 1-input function.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType3Function.#ctor
member.summary: Initilizes a new PDFType3Function object.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType3Function.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the intervals to which the functions apply.
member.remarks: This property is an An array of k - 1 numbers that, in combination with Domain, define the intervals to which each function from the Functions list applies. Bounds elements must be in order of increasing value, and each value must be within the domain defined by Domain.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType3Function.Encode
member.summary: Gets or sets the function's encoding array.
member.remarks: The encode is an array of 2*k numbers that, taken in pairs, map each subset of the domain defined by Domain and the Bounds array to the domain of the corresponding function.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType3Function.Functions
member.summary: Gets the list of functions that make up this function.
member.remarks: An array of k 1-input functions making up the stitching function. The output dimensionality of all functions must be the same, and compatible with the value of Range if Range is present.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Functions.PDFType4Function
member.summary: Defines a type 4 function.
member.remarks: A type 4 function, also called a PostScript calculator function, is represented as a stream containing code written in a small subset of the PostScript language.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode
member.summary: Specifies the available blend modes.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.None
member.summary: Same as Normal, but for internal library use.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.Normal
member.summary: Selects the source color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of backdrop and source color values, and then complements the result.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors depending on the backdrop color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors depending on the source color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors depending on the source color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituents colors from the lighter.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Same as Difference, but lower in contrast.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminance of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.Saturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminance of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.Color
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation and hue of the source color and the luminance of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminance of the source color and the saturation and hue of the backdrop color.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBasicCanvas.DrawImage
member.summary: Draws an image specified by a file name, a pair of coordinates, a width and a height.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBasicCanvas.DrawImage(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFKeepAspectRatio,System.Int32,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFImageCompression)
member.summary: Draws an image specified by a file name, a pair of coordinates, a width and a height.
member.returns: A double value specifying the calculated image dimension, based on the requested aspect ratio.
member.remarks: This function is used to draw an image on the canvas. The top left corner of the image is placed at left,top coordinates. The width and the height of the drawn images are set by the corresponding parameters. The image is rotated around the top left corner with a number of degrees specified by the orientation parameter. Depending on the keepAspectRatio parameter, the width or the height can be computed automatically. Based on the keepAspectRatio parameter, the width or the height can be computed automatically. If KeepWidth is used, then the height is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated height. If KeepHeight is used, then the width is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated width. If KeepNone or KeepBoth are used, then the given width and height parameters are used. The return of the function is -1. The following image formats are supported: jpeg, gif, bmp, png, emf. The activeFrame parameter specifies the frame index within a multiframe image. When a multiframe image is requested to be drawn on the page, this index selects the frame within the image that will be drawn on the page. This property is used by images that include multiple images within the same file, like gif or tiff. The other supported image formats ignore this property. This index is zero based. If the frame does not exist in the image, then the first frame will be considered for display.
member.param: a full path to the image file.
the x coordinate of the top left corner of the image.
the y coordinate of the top left corner of the image.
the width of the image.
the height of the image.
the orientation of the image.
a KeepAspectRatio enumeration member specifying how the original aspect ratio of the image should be handled.
the index of the frame within the image to be drawn on the page.
the compression method used to store image data in the PDF file.

member.param: a Stream object storing image data.
the x coordinate of the top left corner of the image.
the y coordinate of the top left corner of the image.
the width of the image.
the height of the image.

If KeepHeight is used, then the width is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated width. member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBasicCanvas.DrawImage(System.IO.Stream,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFKeepAspectRatio,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws an image specified by a stream, a pair of coordinates, a width and a height.
member.returns: A float value specifying the calculated image dimension, based on the requested aspect ratio.
member.remarks: This function is used to draw an image on the canvas. The top left corner of the image is placed at left,top coordinates. The width and the height of the drawn images are set by the corresponding parameters. The image is rotated around the top left corner with a number of degrees specified by the orientation parameter. Depending on the keepAspectRatio parameter, the width or the height can be computed automatically. Based on the keepAspectRatio parameter, the width or the height can be computed automatically. If KeepWidth is used, then the height is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated height. If KeepHeight is used, then the width is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated width. If KeepNone or KeepBoth are used, then the given width and height parameters are used. The return of the function is -1. The following image formats are supported: jpeg, gif, bmp, png, emf. The activeFrame parameter specifies the frame index within a multiframe image. When a multiframe image is requested to be drawn on the page, this index selects the frame within the image that will be drawn on the page. This property is used by images that include multiple images within the same file, like gif or tiff. The other supported image formats ignore this property. This index is zero based. If the frame does not exist in the image, then the first frame will be considered for display.
member.param: a Stream object storing image data.
the x coordinate of the top left corner of the image.
the y coordinate of the top left corner of the image.
the width of the image.
the height of the image.
the orientation of the image.
a KeepAspectRatio enumeration member specifying how the original aspect ratio of the image should be handled.
the index of the frame within the image to be drawn on the page.

The rectangle is rotated counterclockwise from the x axis around the top left corner with a number of degrees specified by the orientation parameter.
member.param: a PDFPen object used to draw the border of the rectangle.
a PDFBrush object used to fill the interior of the rectangle.
the x coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
the y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
the width of the rectangle.
the height of the rectangle.
the width of the ellipse used to draw the rounded corners.
the height of the ellipse used to draw the rounded corners.
the orientation of the rectangle.

A YAxisDirection enumeration member specifying the new direction of the Y axis.

member.summary: Sets a clipping region on page's canvas.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBasicCanvas.SetExtendedGraphicState(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFExtendedGraphicState)
member.summary: Sets the current graphic state in the content stream.
member.param: The new graphic state.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBasicCanvas.SetLogicalUnit(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFLogicalUnitBase)
member.summary: Sets the logical unit for the drawing operations.
member.remarks: The default logical unit used to position graphic objects on the page is the PDF point (1/72 inches). During the drawing operations, the logical unit can be changed in order to achieve desired functionality. In this way, some objects can be positioned on the page using one logical unit, while other objects can be positioned using another logical unit.
member.param: The new measure unit for subsequent drawing operations.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBasicCanvas.SetOrigin(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the new point of origin for the coordinate system.
member.remarks: This method moves the origin of the coordinate system to the new position. The new position is always given relative to the current origin. The values specifying the new origin are given in logical units.
member.param: The X coordinate of the origin.
The Y coordinate of the origin.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBasicCanvas.SetOverprint(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the overprint for the subsequent drawing (stroke and fill) operations.
member.remarks: If true, the overprint is enabled for subsequent drawing (stroke and/or fill) operations.
member.param: a value indicating whether overprint is enabled or not for stroke operations.
a value indicating whether overprint is enabled or not for fill operations.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBasicCanvas.SetTransparency(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the transparency level for the subsequent drawing operations.
member.remarks: The transparency level can take any value between 0 and 100. 100 means full transparency (100), 0 means opaque (0 transparency).
member.param: a double value specifying the transparency level.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFLogicalUnitBase
member.summary: Base class for all the classes that implement custom logical units.
member.remarks: This class is the base class for implementing user defined logical units. All classes that represent a custom defined logical unit must implement two methods: ToPDFUnitX( float unit ) and ToPDFUnitY( float unit ). These 2 methods need to define the mapping between the logical unit and measure unit used by pdf files, which is the point (1/72 inches). These 2 methods allow to define custom mappings between logical unit and pdf unit (point) for each axis. The mapping between the logical unit and the pdf unit shows how many pdf units correspond to a logical unit.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFLogicalUnitBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFLogicalUnitBase object.

member.summary: Defines the mapping between the logical unit and the pdf unit for the X axis
member.remarks: This method is used to convert the X coordinates, which are always expressed in logical units, of a graphic object to pdf units on X axis.
member.param: the number of logical units to be converted to pdf units.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFLogicalUnitBase.ToPDFUnitY(System.Double)
member.summary: Defines the mapping between the logical unit and the pdf unit for the Y axis
member.remarks: This method is used to convert the Y coordinates, which are always expressed in logical units, of a graphic object to pdf units on Y axis.
member.param: the number of logical units to be converted to pdf units.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFPen object of the specified color and width.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFPen object.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen.#ctor(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFColor)
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFPen object of the specified color.
member.param: the color of the pen.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen.#ctor(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFColor,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFPen object of the specified color and width.
member.remarks: The width of the pen is always set in points.
member.param: the color of the pen.
the width of the pen.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen.#ctor(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen)
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFPen object based on the given pen.
member.param: the pen to copy.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of this PDFPen object.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen.DashOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance from the start of a line to the beginning of a dash pattern.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen.DashPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of custom dashes and spaces.
member.remarks: A custom dashed line is drawn using a dash pattern specified as an array of float values. The odd values represent the length of the dashes in the pattern, and the even values represent the length of the spaces in the pattern. The pattern is repeated until the whole line is drawn.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen.DashStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style used for dashed lines drawn with this Pen object.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen.LineCap
member.summary: Gets or sets the cap style used at the beginning and the end of lines drawn with this Pen object.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen.LineJoin
member.summary: Gets or sets the join style for the ends of two consecutive lines drawn with this Pen object.
member.remarks: This join style is used by lines, polygon and rectangle objects.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of this PDFPen object.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPointLogicalUnit
member.summary: Defines the point (pdf unit) as a logical unit.
member.remarks: This class defines the point as a logical unit. The mapping between logical unit and pdf unit is one-to-one, one logical unit equals to one pdf unit. The mapping functions simply return the value given as parameter.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPointLogicalUnit.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new PDFPointLogicalUnit object.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPointLogicalUnit.ToPDFUnitX(System.Double)
member.summary: Defines the mapping between the logical unit and the pdf unit for the X axis
member.remarks: This method is used to convert the X coordinates, which are always expressed in logical units, of a graphic object to pdf units on X axis.
member.param: the number of logical units to be converted to pdf units.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPointLogicalUnit.ToPDFUnitY(System.Double)
member.summary: Defines the mapping between the logical unit and the pdf unit for the Y axis
member.remarks: This method is used to convert the Y coordinates, which are always expressed in logical units, of a graphic object to pdf units on Y axis.
member.param: the number of logical units to be converted to pdf units.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Barcodes.BarcodeTextLocation
member.summary: Specifies the available locations for displaying text on a linear barcode.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Barcodes.BarcodeTextLocation.None
member.summary: Barcode text is not displayed.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Barcodes.BarcodeTextLocation.Above
member.summary: Barcode text is placed above the bar code.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Barcodes.BarcodeTextLocation.AboveEmbedded
member.summary: Barcode text is partially embedded at the top of the bar code. The top of the text is aligned with the top of the bars.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Barcodes.BarcodeTextLocation.Below
member.summary: Barcode text is placed below the bar code.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Barcodes.BarcodeTextLocation.BelowEmbedded
member.summary: Barcode text is partially embedded in the bottom of the bar code. The baseline of the text is aligned with the bottom of the bars.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Barcodes.DataMatrixEncoding
member.summary: Specifies the available encoding modes for a DataMatrix barcode.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Barcodes.DataMatrixEncoding.Auto
member.summary: The encoding is determined automatically based on the data to encode.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Barcodes.DataMatrixEncoding.ASCII
member.summary: The data to encode contains ASCII characters only (0x00 - 0x7F). Extended ASCII characters (0x80 - 0xFF) are also supported.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Barcodes.DataMatrixEncoding.Base256
member.summary: The data to encode is a binary stream.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Barcodes.DataMatrixEncoding.Numeric
member.summary: The data to encode contains only numbers (ASCII characters 0x30 - 0x39)

member.summary: Level 6 - 128 error correction codewords.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Barcodes.PDF417ErrorCorrectionLevel.Level7
member.summary: Level 7 - 256 error correction codewords.
